name: Hiking
description: Canada is known for its incredible natural beauty, with thousands of trails in national and provincial parks.

name: Beachgoing
description: Costa Rica is home to some of the world's most beautiful beaches along both the Pacific and Caribbean coasts.

name: Walking
description: Walking is an easy, low-cost, and accessible way for people to stay active, enjoy nature, and spend time with family or friends.

name: Soccer
description: People of all ages play informal matches in parks, streets, or schoolyards, and watching soccer is a national pastime, especially games involving the national team (El Tri) or local clubs.

name: Swimming
description: With coastlines on both the Pacific Ocean and the Caribbean Sea, Panamanians frequently visit beaches for relaxation, swimming, and socializing.

name: Dancing
description: Dancing is a cornerstone of Colombian culture, and it is enjoyed at family gatherings, public festivals, or even casually in public spaces.

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is the most popular sport in Peru, and it is a common activity in both urban and rural areas.

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is not just a sport in Brazil—it’s a national passion and a way of life. People of all ages play informal matches, known as peladas, in parks, streets, beaches, or improvised fields.

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is the lifeblood of Argentina and the most popular public activity. People play casual matches in parks, fields, and even streets, while watching soccer—especially games involving clubs like Boca Juniors and River Plate or the national team—is a unifying and emotional experience.

name: Walking
description: Uruguay’s rambla, a coastal promenade stretching along cities like Montevideo, is a favorite spot for walking, jogging, cycling, or simply relaxing while enjoying views of the Río de la Plata.

name: Walking
description: Walking is one of the most common and accessible outdoor activities in the UK. People enjoy countryside walks, city strolls, and hikes in scenic areas.

name: Hiking
description: Hikingare deeply ingrained in German culture. With an extensive network of trails, forests, and mountains, Germans of all ages enjoy nature walks and hikes, especially on weekends.

name: Walking
description: The walking or the 'passeggiata' is a beloved Italian tradition where people take a leisurely walk, usually in the early evening, often with family, friends, or pets. It’s a social activity and a chance to relax after the day.

name: Hiking
description: Hiking, referred to as 'gå på tur' (going for a walk or hike), is a cornerstone of Norwegian culture. Norwegians enjoy hiking through forests, mountains, and fjords, taking advantage of their country’s spectacular natural beauty.

name: Walking
description: Walking (Yürüyüş), especially in parks or along waterfronts, is a favorite pastime. Many people enjoy leisurely strolls, often with family or friends, in public gardens or scenic areas.

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is the most popular sport in Algeria, and watching matches, especially those of the national team (Les Fennecs), is a widespread public activity

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is by far the most popular sport in Egypt. Watching football, particularly Egyptian Premier League games or international matches featuring the national team (the Pharaohs), is a widely practiced public activity.

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is the most popular sport in Nigeria, and it enjoys widespread participation and viewership. Local football matches, both professional and informal games, are common in many communities.

name: Jogging
description: In urban areas, fitness culture, particularly jogging and cycling, is gaining traction.

name: Hiking
description: Given the country’s beautiful landscapes and climate, outdoor activities like hiking, visiting nature reserves, going on safaris, or spending time at the beach are very popular.

name: Soccer
description: Soccer is the most popular sport in Saudi Arabia, with many people attending matches, participating in local leagues, or following international football events.

name: Cricket
description: Cricket is by far the most popular sport in Pakistan, and it unites people from all walks of life. Whether playing in the streets, parks, or local grounds, or watching matches on television or at stadiums, cricket is a national obsession.

name: Cricket
description: Cricket is by far the most popular sport in India. It is not just a game but a passion that unites people across different states and communities.

name: Ice Hockey
description: People of all ages play ice hockey in local rinks or participate in informal games during the winter.

name: Table Tennis
description: China has dominated international table tennis competitions for decades, with the national team consistently producing world-class players.

name: Walking
description: Japanese people have a long-standing cultural and spiritual connection to nature. Parks, gardens, and outdoor spaces are widely used for relaxation, walks, and exercise, reflecting the importance of balancing urban life with time spent in natural settings.

name: Muay Thai
description: Muay Thai, the traditional Thai martial art, is both a sport and a cultural activity. It’s widely practiced by locals and also enjoyed as a spectator sport in various regions of the country.

name: Basketball
description: Basketball is often played in public spaces such as neighborhood courts, schools, and open fields.

name: Rugby
description: Rugby is more than just a sport in New Zealand; it’s a way of life. Major rugby events, such as the Rugby World Cup and domestic competitions like the Super Rugby league, draw huge crowds and inspire widespread celebrations.

name: Cricket
description: ricket is another sport that has a massive following, particularly during the summer months. People gather to watch international matches or play casual games in parks and beaches.
